newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money stable at 5.0/6.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money stable at 5.0/6.0 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was stable at 5.0/6.0 percent in early Friday trading amid ample liquidity and weekly corporate tax payments, dealers said.
"Liquidity remains ample despite the weekly tax payments. Large central bank injection into the money market today kept the rates at low levels," one local bank dealer said.
Indonesia's central bank, Bank Indonesia, supplied some 1.170 trillion rupiah on the money market early on Friday, money traders said.
One- and three-month money were at 11.00/11.25 and 12.50/12.75 percent, respectively.
The central bank offered one-week SBI at 6.50 percent, two at 8.50 percent and one-month at 10.25 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Thursday was 6.8 percent against 9.70 percent on Wednesday.
